gurmukhi: mD ko nwm aucwir kY hw pd bhur aucwir ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ky lIjY su kib suDwir ]59]
transliteration: Madh Ko Naam Oucdaar(i) Kai Haa Pad Bahur Oucdaar(i)|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ke Leejai Su Kabi Suddaar(i)||59||
translation: Saying “Madhu” in the beginning and then uttering “Ha” the poets speak correctly the names of Sudarshan Chakra.59.

gurmukhi: nrkwsur piRQmY aucir pun irpu Sbd bKwn ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ko cqur ic`q mY jwn ]60]
transliteration: Narkaasur Prithmai Ouchar(i) Poun Rip(u) Shabad Bakhaan|| Naam Sudarshan Chhakra Ko Chatur Chitt Mai Jaan||60||
translation: Uttering firstly the word “Narakasura” and then the word “Ripu” is pronounced, O wise people ! the names of Sudrashan Chakra are comprehended.60.

gurmukhi: dYq bkqR ko nwm kih sUdn bhur aucwr ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ko jwn ic`q inrDwr ]61]
transliteration: Dait Baktra Ko Naam Kah(i) Soodan Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Sudarshan Chhakra Ko Jaan Chitt Nirdhaar||61||
translation: Utteigng the name of eh demon Bakartra and then speaking the word “Shoodan”, the names of Sudarshan Chakra are spoken.61.

gurmukhi: piRQm cMdyrI nwQ ko lIjY nwm bnwie ]pun irpu Sbd aucwrIAY c`kR nwm huie jwie ]62]
transliteration: Pritham Channderrinaath Ko Leejai Naam Banaae|| Poun Rip(u) Shabad Oucdareeai Chakkra Naam Hue Jaae||62||
translation: Naming Chanderinath Shishupal in the beginning and then speaking the word “Ripu”, the names of Sudarshan Chakra are formed.62.

gurmukhi: nrkwsur ko nwm kih mrdn bhur aucwr ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ko lIjhu su kib suDwr ]63]
transliteration: Narkaasur Ko Naam Kah(i) Mardan Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ko Leejoh Su Kabisudhaar||63||
translation: Uttering “Narakasura” firstly and then saying the words “Anuj” and Aayudh”, many names of Sudarshan Chakra continue to be evolved.63.

gurmukhi: ikSn ibSn kih ijs Anuj AwXuD bhur aucwr ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ky inksq clih Apwr ]64]
transliteration: Kishan Bishan Kah(i) Jis Anuj Aayudh Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ke Niksat Chalah Apaar||64||
translation: Uttering the word "Krishan, Vishnu" and then saying the words "Anuj" and Aayudh", many names of Sudarshan Chakra continue to be evolved.64.

gurmukhi: b`jR Anuj piRQmY aucr iPir pd SsqR bKwn ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ky cqur ic`q mY jwn ]65]
transliteration: Bajjra Anuj Prithmai Ouchar Phir(i) Pad Shastra Bakhaan|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ke Chatur Chitt Mai Jaan||65||
translation: Speaking the words “Vajra and Anuj” in the beginning and then adding the word “Shastar”, in the names of Sudarshan Chakra are known.65.

gurmukhi: piRQm ibrh pd aucr kY pun khu SsqR ibsyK ]nwm sudrSn ckR ky inksq clY AsyK ]66]
transliteration: Pritham Birah Pad Ouchar Kai Poun Kaho Shastra Bisekh|| Naam Sudarshan Charka Ke Niksat Chalai Asekh||66||
translation: Uttering the word “Virah” in the beginning and then speaking many names of Sudarshan CHakra continue to be formed.66.

gurmukhi: piRQmY vhY aucwrIAY ir`D is`D ko Dwm ]pun pd SsqR bKwnIAY jwnu c`kR ky nwm ]67]
transliteration: Prithmai Vahai Oucdareeai Riddh Siddh Ko Dhaam|| Poun Pad Shastra Bakhaaneeai Jaan(u) Chakkra Ke Naam||67||
translation: Uttering firstly the name of Ishwara, the treasure of all powers and then adding the word “Shastar”, the names of Chakra continue to be formed.67.

gurmukhi: igrDr piRQm aucwir pd AwXuD bhur aucwir ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ky inksq clY Apwr ]68]
transliteration: Girdhar Pritham Oucdaar(i) Pad Aayudh Bahur Udaar(i)|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ke Niksat Chalai Apaar||68||
translation: Uttering the word “Girdhar” in the beginning and then speaking the word “Aayudh”, many names of Sudarshan Chakra continue to be evolved.68.

gurmukhi: kwlI nQIAw piRQm kih SsqR Sbd khu AMq ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ky inksq jwih AnMq ]69]
transliteration: Kaalinatheeaa Pritham Kah(i) Shastra Shabad Kaho Ant|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ke Niksat Jaah(i) Anant||69||
translation: Speaking the word “Kalinath” in the beginning and then adding the word “Shastar” at the end, innumerable names of Sudarshan Chakra continue to be formed.69.

gurmukhi: kMs kyishw piRQm kih iPir kih SsqR ibcwr ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ky lIjhu su kib suDwr ]70]
transliteration: Kans Kesihaa Pritham Kah(i) Phir(i) Kah(i) Shastra Bichaar|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ke Leejoh Su Kabisudhaar||70||
translation: Uttering firstly the name of the killer of Kansa-Keshi i.e. Krishna and then reflecting on the names of weapons, the poets pronounce the names of Sudarshan Chakra.70.

gurmukhi: bkI bkwsur Sbd kih Puin bc S`qRu aucwr ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ky inksq clYN Apwr ]71]
transliteration: Bakibakaasur Shabad Kah(i) Phoun(i) Bach Shattr(u) Ouchaar|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ke Niksat Chalain Apaar||71||
translation: Saying the worlds “Bakasura and Baki” and then uttering the word “Shatru”, the names of Sudarshan Chakra continue to be formed.71.

gurmukhi: AGnwsn AGhw aucr pun bc SsqR bKwn ]nwm sudrSn c`kR ky sBY cqur icq jwn ]72]
transliteration: Aghnaasan Agh-hiouchar Poun Bach Shastra Bakhaan|| Naam Sudarshan Chakkra Ke Sabhai Chatur Chit Jaan||72||
translation: Uttering the name of the Lord, the destroyer of sins, and then describing the weapons, the wise people know the names of Sudarshan Chakra.72.
